Dear Jim:
After considerable narrowing of our list and a great
deal of talking to people back Pnd forth, vie are making
tentative plans to have Karl wynn meet Seymour Siegel,
Dick Hull, Burton Paulu, Wilbur Schramm, and me in
Washington the evening of October 16 and the morning of
October 17 for a lengthy discussion of the possibilities
of his joining a is as our second executive Director*
All of the above plus Prank Schooley have expressed the
opinion that Wynn is by far our besT> bet. Allen says
he feels that we should, not pull him into the Washington
meeting because of the distance involved. Frank is
still tracing some references on Wynn and the meeting
Kill not be definitely called until all of those
references are in.
The reason for meeting in Washington is that Dick
Hull vdll be in Washington on the 16th on business and
we will not have to pay his expenses. Washington is
easily accessible for 3i, Karl, and me. Only Wilbur
and Burton will have a trip of any significance. All
of the above mentioned except Wilbur have approved
NAKB financing of this meeting. If you think further
authorisation for the meeting should be secured - by
a poll of the remainder of the Board - I will be glad
to get it, but it does not strike me as necessary.
I think I wrote you before requesting a reaction to
Wynn but should like to repeat that request sire© I have
not heard from you.
